column1: he's a little squared up as Jayed gets the ball to straighten off the pitch. And since the length is beautiful as well - full but not drivable - Hope is stuck in his crease, playing towards mid-on. Ends up getting a leading edge into the covers
solid forward defensive
drives sweetly to mid-off
lovely shape again from Jayed, the outswing making sure Ambris' attempted flick through midwicket ends up near the point boundary
top shot! Spots the short ball early and wallops it to the midwicket boundary

another short ball and another dismissive put-away! Mashrafe is too slow to be bowling that length. Especially when it doesn't even rise up to his hips. Ambris swivels in his back foot and pulls it behind square
straying on the pads again and Ambris dabs it to the left of short fine leg
swing and miss as Mashrafe switches his line outside off. Plenty of room for the cut shot but maybe he goes at it too hard and loses his shape
targets the top of off and Ambris shuffles in his crease to flick the ball through straight midwicket
back of a length around off stump, he taps it to cover
top shot again! He's very good on the drive and Jayed offers up the invitation, pitching the ball up and offering room for Ambris to free the arms and lift it over extra cover
fullish and this time he swings the ball into the right-hander - good tricks - and Ambris shows it some respect
laces it through the covers. Outstanding shot from Ambris. He looks in a mood today. Although it doesn't take a genius to send a wide half volley packing
chops the back of a length delivery on off stump to deep third man
another lovely drive, this time from Hope, as he stride forward confidently to the ball outside off. Finds mid-off though
keeps him in his crease by pulling the length back. Hope is as careful as ever, defending the ball right under his eyes
cuts a shortish delivery to point. Not quite enough room to go full throttle
good technique, allowing the full, slightly slower, ball to come to him, and then artfully flicking it to midwicket
hits the deck a little harder and gets some response as the back of a length ball straigtens to take Ambris' outside edge behind point
too easy as Mashrafe slips into the pads and Hope flicks it away to the backward square leg boundary.
full on off stump and Hope is on the drive immediately. Solidly hit but Mashrafe gets down to stop it himself
flicks a back of a length ball down to short fine leg

shot of the morning! How he leeeeeans into that cover drive! Even as that ball swings away, attempting to escape his magic hands. But Hope holds his shape, moves his front leg across to the ball, gets nice and low over the ball, and then gently directs it to the boundary
back of a length and outside off, lets it go
blocks the fuller delivery on off stump to mid-off
loads up the drive again but finds mid-off
blocks the good length ball that shapes into the right-hander just a tiny bit

another glorious drive from Hope, this time straighter of cover. There's a man inside the circle, diving to his right to save a certain boundary. Delicious strokeplay starting from the measured front foot stride and the conscious decision to only time the ball
pulls the short ball to deep square leg. Mashrafe looks ridiculously out of sorts this morning. Too slow. Too stiff. And too wayward
nudges a fuller delivery to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, lets it go
angles the shortish ball into the right-hander, and Ambris, even as he tries to make room, isn't able to get enough to play a full-blooded cut shot. Just a tap to point

gooone! Tame end to a promising innings and Mashrafe barely celebrates. Just glowers at everything in sight as if blaming it for his poor form until this very moment, when a shortish delivery outside off stump is basically guided to a wide slip fielder like it's catching practice. Soumya dives to his right and picks up a smart catch
good length, outside off, from round the wicket. Bravo covers the off stump and lets it go
loops it up on off stump, and a tame, loopy offbreak suddenly takes on threatening proportions when it dips on the right-hander. Hope has to hurry into a block
pushes forward and drives to mid-on. Good start from Mehidy. Targeting the stumps, lovely flight too
angles it into off stump and the full ball just straightens enough for Bravo to be wary of and defend
this slides on with the arm - natural variation - and Bravo plays for turn, blocking on off stump, only to get an inside edge through square leg

lunges forward to try and get to the pitch of the ball a shade outside off, and though he isn't there, he tries to bring his wrists into the drive and try and whip the ball to cover. Doesn't quite pull it off
this time he does reach the ball on the half-volley outside off and nails it to the long-off boundary
tries to tuck away the shortish delivery from round the wicket through midwicket. Can't hit the gap
goes for an on the up drive through the covers and because the ball gets big on him, he yanks the bottom hand off the bat

launches it down the ground! Outrageous shot from Bravo. Just plants his front leg down and because there's room on offer he just goes after the ball. That means a short ball has been slapped straight down the ground. Wicked!
back of a length on off stump, Bravo defends
plays with soft hands, looking to pinch a single off a short ball that comes up to his chest. No such luck
good length on off stump, defends it
goes back to nudge a good length ball to midwicket. Hope wants the single, Bravo doesn't. And in the end, they recover from the mix-up
shifts his weight back because the ball is only on a good length and then punches it with the turn towards long-on
another push towards long-on, but midwicket cuts across as well
waits on the good length ball on off stump a little more this time to try and turn it behind square leg. Still no luck with the single
there's the tossed up ball. After a few shorter ones to build pressure. Looking for a release shot, Hope?, asks Mehidy. Hope answers with a stout forward defensive
stays back to the length ball on middle and drills it to long-on
too short and Hope just swivels on his back foot and pulls it down to the fine leg boundary. Easily done
whips a short ball outside off away to deep midwicket. Outstanding shot. Needs to wait for the ball, wait till it's right under his eyes to executed it perfectly and he does.

dropped by Mehidy! He's at point, running in to try and get under a steepler. Poor shot from Bravo, going for an on the up loft over the bowler's head but being beaten for lack of pace. Mehidy tracks it. He's goes for it. But he's really nowhere near it, having to dive forward and in the end, he doesn't even get his hands to it
nudges a shortish delivery behind square leg
clips a shortish delivery on middle and off to short fine leg
defends a shortish delivery on off stump to point
bit of a leading edge as he tries to flick a tossed up ball on middle through mid-on. But it drifts away just a tiny bit and makes him get squared up. A tangled up block back to the bowler
turns the ball on middle through midwicket

huge appeal for lbw and he has his man! Dropped him in the last over, traps him in this, with a slider on off stump. Bravo plays outside the line, looking for turn. There isn't any and he's pinned in front. Would probably have gone on to hit leg stump. At least in umpire Kettleborough's mind and we don't have DRS to get confirmation in this series.
lovely dip, and it happens at the last second too, making Hope reach in front of himself to try and make contact with the ball on off stump
quicker delivery on off stump and Chase flicks it to midwicket
a little too short that time and Chase has the opportunity to get off the mark with a punch to long-on

huge lbw shout but umpire Neill thinks it might be sliding down. And he's right. Mashrafe finally gets his length right and the ball skids through as well, pitching on off stump and cutting into the right-hander, making him play across the line
drills it towards midwicket, where Mahmudullah falls over the ball and lets it through to the boundary
shapes to cut the ball, sensing there's enough room for it, but Mashrafe gets it to nip into the right-hander again, surprising Chase
gets forward to block with an open face outside off. Finds point
hits him on the thigh as Mashrafe hits the deck outside off and getting it to seam into Chase, hurry into him.

another lbw appeal but umpire Neill says too high. Oooh, this is good stuff. Mashrafe's finally warmed up. He should be having bowled six overs and his indippers are causing all sorts of problems. Too much movement off the pitch keeps catching the batsman stuck in his crease, panicking and playing across the line
leans forward, getting to the pitch of the ball on middle and driving it to long-on
gets it past the right of slip. Not convincing, but it's still runs on the board. An intentional back foot glide, even though danger lurks. What's Chase thinking...
works it into the leg side, past midwicket
extra bounce as Mehidy hits a good length outside off and surprises Hope who is trying to flick the ball to midwicket and has to yank his bottom hand off the bat
flicks through midwicket
drives smoothly to long-on
inside edge as Chase stays too upright while playing away from his body. The shot meant to skirt away through the covers goes instead to long leg
good length ball on middle, Hope blocks and demands the single, but again he's met with an answer in the negative
top edge but it lobs over the short fine leg fielder. The mis-hit is because Hope is into the pull shot too early and the short ball nearly does the trick
adjusts to Jayed's limited pace better as he now rocks back and across and cuts to deep point
stops on him and Hope nearly pops a return catch. Jayed's ability to keep it wicket to wicket will give him reward sooner or later
slower ball on off stump, Hope dabs it towards point and sprints through. Good response from Chase too
looks to drive towards long-on, but Mehidy's drift secures a bit of a leading edge back to him
loops it up outside off, Hope lunges forward and across to block
picks the flatter trajectory early, going back to flick the ball through square leg
shimmies down the pitch but Mehidy pulls his length back just enough that Chase's flick is mistimed, and almost carries to midwicket
good length ball outside off, defends to cover
whips the full delivery on leg stump away to deep midwicket. Outstanding shot, especially seeing as he yanked his front foot back, which is right where the ball pitched, to open up room for the shot
defends a fullish delivery on off stump back at the bowler
lifts a fuller delivery on middle away to deep midwicket
goes for the on the up drive but Jayed doesn't really have the pace for those shots and it shows, mistimed hit to cover
eases the shortish delivery outside off to point
full and outside off, bunts it back down the pitch
punches a length ball down the ground to long-on
gets the dip just right and the flick that Hope intends to keep along the ground goes in the air through midwicket
rocks back to punch the short ball outside off to long-on
goes back to force the ball down the ground, but hits straight to the bowler
uses the depth of the crease well to flick a good length ball on middle behind square leg
keeps low and Hope just about manages to make contact. Lucky the line of the ball was way outside off
full on middle and leg, Hope works it through midwicket
length ball on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
fuller, angling away from off stump. A little late getting forward to push into the off side, ends up playing it off the inside half of the bat through square leg
back of a length, angling across to off stump, clipped to midwicket
overpitched, a fair amount of width too, leans into a drive to the right of the sweeper at deep cover point
length ball slanting away from off stump, punched to extra-cover
back of a length on off stump, worked away to the right of deep square leg, nicely placed
length ball, skids on with the angle towards middle stump, blocked back down the pitch
back of a length, again goes with the angle towards off stump, punched into the covers
goes back to a length ball on middle stump, punched to straight midwicket
down the track now to one with a bit more flight on off stump, driven to long-off
goes back to a length ball sliding on towards off stump, punched into the point region
full now, a bit more flight on off stump, defended firmly back to the bowler, an excellent start from Shakib

gone, West Indies are three down! Not the most wicket-taking of deliveries, back of a length and angling across to off stump. Looks to play a forcing back-foot flick, and plays a little early and ends up popping a simple catch to midwicket
back of a length, nips in from outside off to cramp Carter a little as he tries to dab down to third man. Can only play a defensive jab in the end
ooh, well bowled. A bit of extra bounce, and too close to cut anyway, the outside edge is beaten
full, a bit of swing in towards off stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length, once again some late inward movement to cramp Carter, jabbed down towards the fielder at gully
length ball on off stump, punched firmly back to the bowler
tossed up full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
again it's nice and full, and again Hope drives it firmly back where it came from
flat, sliding on down the leg side. Looks to open up and work it into the leg side but it skids through too quick and hits him on the pad. Nearly rolls between his legs and onto the stumps
length ball on off stump, punched down to long-off
tossed up on off stump, clipped with the turn to midwicket
flatter length ball on middle and off, clipped to midwicket
length ball close to off stump, angling away. Looks to punch square on the off side, ends up playing slightly inside the line and guiding it finer than he intended, to the left of third man
fullish outside off, driven with a roll of the wrists to backward point
back of a length on off stump, whipped away wide of mid-on
tossed up outside off, leans across to try and lap-sweep, misses and is hit on the fron tpoad
flat length ball on off stump, punched back to the bowler
flat again, doesn't spin this time, looks to defend and gets an outside edge into the point region
a touch shorter, goes deep in his crease to dab to the right of short third man
a bit more air on this, swept into the midwicket region

given! Back of a length, angling into the stumps, and he's caught on the crease as he looks to work it across the line. Skids on with a bit of inward movement to beat the inside edge. Was that missing leg stump, possibly? No DRS, and Carter doesn't look too happy
back of a length, angling away from off stump, and Holder, looking to jab away from the body without moving his feet, is beaten first ball
back of a length outside off, lets it come on and dabs to third man. That brings up West Indies' 100
fullish outside off, driven firmly but can't beat extra-cover
overpitched, and he misses out, drives straight to extra-cover once more
back of a length, angling away from off stump, punched to that man at extra-cover once more
full on middle stump, clipped to straight midwicket
flat, back of a length, slides on down the leg side. Looks to flick and misses, is hit on the pad
flighted ball drifting in towards off stump, blocked back to the bowler
again Holder plays for turn when there's none. Slider drifting down leg, gets forward to flick and is hit on the front pad
full close to off stump, defended into the covers
flat length ball angling in towards off and middle, keeps his front pad away from the line and defends into the covers
shortish, angling across to off stump. Jumps to ride the bounce and work it to the right of midwicket
back of a length, angling away from off stump. Holder pokes and misses, not really moving his feet
fuller now, on off stump, and Holder drives sweetly, with high left elbow, to the right of the sweeper at deep point. Excellent timing, and he forces Sabbir Rahman into a sprawling dive
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length outside off, lets it come on and dabs to third man
full, angling away into a fifth-stump line, chases at it with a flat-bat drive, misses
flighted ball drifting in towards middle stump, clipped away through square leg
back of a length on middle and leg, whipped to deep square leg
flat length ball straightening towards off stump, defended into the covers
lovely change of pace, similar trajectory and line to the previous one, but slower and it dips shorter. Pushes at it in defence and only manages an inside edge into the leg side
length ball on the stumps, looks to push into the leg side, can't really time it
down the track to the flighted ball on off and middle, clipped down to long-on
length ball on off stump, goes on the back foot to work it down the ground to long-on
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and dabs with soft hands to the left of backward point. Brings up his fifty with that shot

fullish close to off stump, looks to push to long-off, plays slightly early and pops it in the air briefly. Shakib moves quickly from extra-cover to field it, and there's a bit of hesitation in running the single. Had Shakib's throw hit at the bowler's end, Holder would have been gone
fullish on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
shortish on off stump, worked away through square leg
short, wide, a bit of gentle outswing. Goes too hard at the slash and misses
back of a length, sliding down leg. Looks to work it off the back foot and misses, and it hits him on the left pad
fuller now, on the stumps, clipped through square leg
back of a length on off stump, punched into the covers
down the track, makes a bit of room, can't force this wide-ish length ball past extra-cover
flat length ball on off stump, looks to go back and work it to long-on but straight midwicket cuts off the angle
back of a length outside off, eased to deep point off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, punched to extra-cover
fullish on the pads, clipped to the right of long-on
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
a boundary, whodathunk! Back of a length on off stump, sits up nicely, and Holder clears his front leg and flat-bats it up and over mid-off
four more. Back of a length on off stump again, and this time he plays a front-foot whip-pull over midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face and steers to the right of third man
nice length on off stump, draws Holder forward but not close enough to the pitch to drive. Defended into the covers
flatter on off stump, punched off the back foot back to the bowler
a bit more flight, uses his reach to clip this from off stump to the left of deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump, gets back and across to work it through square leg
tossed up just outside off, gets on the front foot to drive to the right of long-off
length ball on off stump, clipped with the turn to deep midwicket
length ball on off stump, straightens a little. Stays on the back foot to defend to mid-off
full, on the pads, and that's not quite timed, but it'll do. Uses his reach to flick this over the top, and into the gap to the right of long-on. One bounce and over the rope
back of a length on off stump, clipped down to long-on
back of a length on off stump, whipped to midwicket
back of a length, fourth-stump line, punched down to long-on
back of a length on off stump, straightens a bit off the pitch. Looks to play it down to long-on with a slightly closed face, and the ball pops off the leading edge to the right of extra-cover
big appeal for lbw as Holder misses the front-foot flick, but I'm guessing this was spinning too much. Lovely length, catches Holder half-forward
flat length ball outside off, Holder looks to use his reach and work it leg side. Plays too early, with hard hands, and sends a leading edge ballooning over the point region
a bit closer to off stump, clipped to deep midwicket
another big appeal, this time for caught behind, as Holder plays an awkward-looking sweep from outside off - just strode forward without getting down low, and the ball sneaked under his bat
nice flight outside off, Holder flicks in the air, but to the left of the diving midwicket fielder
flatter length ball on off stump, worked away through square leg
length ball on middle stump, nice bit of fielding at midwicket, a dive to the right to stop Hope's well-timed flick
now Hope finds the boundary. Length ball on off stump and Hope takes a step forward, plants his left foot away from the line of the ball, and flat-bats it between bowler and mid-off
full, nearly in the blockhole on off stump, clipped down to long-on
full on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length, drifts down leg. Holder can't put bat onto ball as he tries to glance it fine
full outside off, stretches forward to drive to mid-off
fullish on off stump, clipped down to long-on
back of a length, spinning back in towards off stump. Goes deep in his crease to punch to long-on, brings up the 50 partnership
lovely length close to off stump. Holder isn't really getting a stride forward, just trusting his reach. Blocked into the covers
tossed up a bit higher on off stump, swept to the left of Shakib at deep backward square leg
nice flight outside off, stretches out to drive to long-off
quickish length ball with a bit of flight, clipped from off stump towards midwicket
a bit wider, driven to the left of long-off

holds up in the pitch and Holder is far too early with his on-the-up push through point, bat wandering well away from his body. Luckily for him, the ball lands safely to the right of point and scurries away

cuts him in half as Jayed hits the deck and makes the ball seam into the right-hander. Very close to knocking the top of off stump too as Holder tries to flick the ball through midwicket while staying rooted to the crease
another hit-the-deck delivery but Holder manages to do a lot better, reacting to the cut into him by staying on leg stump, giving himself a little room to guided the ball behind point
goes fuller to Hope though and he drives sweetly to the sweeper cover
clips his pads as he tries to work the length ball on middle behind square leg
stays leg side of the back of a length ball in line with the stumps and slices it to point
shortish and outside off, and Hope makes room to cut it through the covers
goes back to the flatter delivery on off stump and turn it to long-on
tosses it up on off stump and the dip on the ball is enough to keep Holder honest
tries to pinch a run through midwicket, but the good length ball on off stump goes straight to the fielder
waits a little longer to turn the length ball on middle behind square leg
tosses it up on off stump, defends
width on offer and Holder gets forward and lashes it to the sweeper cover

there's the first of the game. Took em long enough! And it's a peach too. For half a second, it seems Hope is cramped up. As if he can't get a full swing of the bat through a ball on his hips. But he goes through with the pick-up shot and it lands well over the boundary at midwicket. Outstanding timing, really.
back of a length and outside off, he steers it to point
turns a stray on his pads to short fine leg
there's the cutter and it beats Holder. Good length ball pitches on leg stump and decks right across the defending right-hander
pushes the fuller delivery on middle and off stump to cover
pitches it up on off stump, Hope wants to attack it, but he can't. There's no room on offer. And he ends up blocking to point
this time he has the length to go after - short - but it cramps him on leg stump and though he makes room, he can only find point
full and angled into middle stump, Hope defends
hacks a good length ball on off stump away to the left of midwicket. Tension building and it shows on Hope. He wants a release shot.
makes room and lashes a flatter delivery on middle stump to cover. Misfield there allows a single
nudges a length ball on middle behind square leg

ridiculously good slower ball. He needs to pull the length back, seeing Holder advance, and then put the cut on the ball to bear the leading edge as the batsman looks for midwicket because he has no other choice. The ball pitches outside leg stump. Instinct tells him to go against the cut and that's where the Fizz is so good. He makes them play against the cut all the time
slogs across the line and even the full pace delivery is working for Mustafiz as Hope misses. Badly
launches it down the ground but there's protection out there, midwicket running around to his left
lovely placement, between point and third man. Hope spots the short and wide ball, moves across onto his back foot, reaches out and concentrates on hitting the gap
gets up onto his tippy-toes to punch a shortish delivery angled across him through point
slices a wide half-volley straight at cover and there's so much power on the shot he misfields
steps out to launch a length ball outside off away to long-on
full and on middle stump, he drives inside out to long-off
makes a little room to carve the good length ball on off stump to the left of cover
goes back to punch a fullish delivery on off stump to long-on
slider, which Holder deals with well enough, staying leg side of the ball and punching it to long-on
slower ball outside off. Holder thinks it's there to be smoked down the ground, but it dips at the last second and so he ends up dragging the ball along the ground to deep midwicket
full and outside off, he slaps it to the left of cover and the right of the sweeper

length ball, HOlder gets under it and heaves it away to deep midwicket. Mehidy is down there and he tries going for the catch, with the ball always dying on him, and as a result he ends up with a sloppy misfield. Fifty for the WI captain
b-e-a-utiful hit! Straight down the ground! Once again it's a length ball and Holder unleashes a full swing of his bat. No holding back. No need either
thats the hundred partnership. Drives the full ball outside off, delivered from round the wicket, to long-off

caught behind! Toe-end of the bat as he goes for the pull shot and Bangladesh have a vital breakthrough at a great time. The angle from round the wicket means Hope is always hitting against it, and it might just have kept a little lower than he expected. Looked good for a third hundred in four ODIs, but he has to walk back now.
tossed up on leg stump, he drives to long-on
good length on off stump, Allen is playing for turn and that's dangerous against Shakib, because there rarely is any. Gets lucky with an inside edge that goes behind square leg
rocks back and punches a shortish delivery outside off to long-on
tossed up on off stump, drives to long-off
looks to slice the shortish delivery on off stump through the covers, but it slides into the right-hander and takes the inside edge
drives through the covers
whacks a length ball on leg stump to long-on. Only a single. Feels like a missed opportunity. Felt like it all innings
length ball wanders down leg side as Allen tries to lift it over backward square leg
back of a length on off stump, defends
drives the full ball on off stump to cover
mis-hits a length ball outside off to mid-off
round the wicket for a length ball on the pads. Holder tries to swing it over midwicket. No luck

caught behind again! He didn't begin the day very well, but he's ending it #LikeABoss! This round the wicket angle is working a treat. Keeps cramping the right-handers. And on the odd occasion he takes the ball across them, they keep playing horizontal bat shots and nicking behind. Hope fell to the pull, Holder falls to the cut. West Indies have been poor in executing their big shots this innings. #Bizarre
tucks a good length ball to midwicket
defends a full ball on off stump
sweeps a length ball on off stump past the left of short fine leg. Nicely done

pins him in front. Lovely response from Shakib. The typical left-arm spinner's delivery. Angled in from round the wicket and straightening just enough that it strikes the pad and not the bat of a batsman playing for turn. Allen has a stride in, but this should hit the stump. Shave leg stump at least. Umpire Kettleborough seems to think so, at least but we don't have DRS in this series for confirmation of that
first ball in ODI cricket and he goes back and dabs to point
full on off stump, defends it
works it away to deep square leg
flicks it to deep midwicket
looks to tuck the ball behind square leg. He does so, but off his pads
gets up off his toes to pull the short ball on middle to long leg
slower yorker on leg stump, Reifer turns it to midwicket to get his first runs in ODIs
back of a length and outside off, he dabs at it, the ball doesn't even go off the square, but they pinch a single even as Mushfiqur runs up from behind the stumps to try to stop them
goes short and Nurse hammers it to deep square leg, well to the right of the man, but Sabbir does wonderfully down there
slower ball sneaks through between bat and pad as Reifer attempts a tentative poke. Bounces in front of the keeper and the resulting fumble allows a bye
pulls the top-pace short ball to deep square leg
shapes to pull a back of a length ball but it sneaks under the bat and through to Mushfiqur
back of a length and outside off, Reifer blocks it, after having been surprised by the extra bounce, but he does secure the single

gets a top edge and a fairly good bouncer, climbing up at Nurse's nose, and making him drag it from outside off with his pull shot - essentially everything you're told while bowling a bouncer in the final overs - ends up going against the bowler.
flicks a length ball through midwicket
slower ball on off stump, he tucks it behind square leg
steers a back of a length delivery outside off behind point
gets down the pitch but Mashrafe adjusts well, bowling the offcutter into the pitch and making the batsman mis-hit the flick. Inside edge off the pads ends up by the pitch
comes down the track again but without too much room on offer he can only flat bat a short ball down to long-on
full on off stump, defends
lifts an attempted yorker on leg stump over to deep square leg

goes high but not long and Sabbir is under that at deep midwicket; he's had a good day in the field and he wraps it up with a fine catch. Mustafizur strikes again, thanks to that brilliant slower ball. Pitches on leg stump. The batsman is too early into the shot and loses his shape. That's why it goes so high instead of long and well... the rest is fairly basic
yorker, veering into the left-hander's toes. Reifer flicks it to long-on
opens the face and steers a full delivery outside off to deep third man

huge appeal for lbw and up goes the finger again. Reifer is pinned in front of middle, surprised by the ball at the Fizz's top pace. It pitches on off stump and skids into him, making him play across the line to midwicket, and miss his shot. The impact is highish on the front pad, but he's stuck deep in his crease and looks pretty much out

almost knocks off stump out! It's the cutter again, pitching outside leg, beating Cottrell's wild, down-the-pitch slog. All it needs to do is hit the target but there is so much spin on the ball that it just skirts past
length ball on off stump, he gets across to defend
lifts a full delivery on middle away to deep midwicket

beautiful slower ball. Roach has no clue where it is, looking one side and the next as his flick is beaten and he's hit on the thigh pad. Only when Mashrafe rushes forward to where silly point might have been does he realise where the ball is
pulls the short ball, angled into him, trying to cramp him up. And the top edge carries it over the ropes at long leg
full and outside leg, he whacks it to deep midwicket
flat bats a length ball down the pitch and it hits Jayed the bowler and wanders away to the leg side
full, angling into a fourth-stump line, driven to short extra-cover
back of a length, top of off stump, defended back towards the bowler

back of a length once more, and this keeps low, only gets up to about knee height a couple of inches outside off stump. Tamim is jumping and crouching all at the same time and he manages to jam his bat down and keep it out
length ball close to off stump, opens his bat face and dabs it towards second slip. Roach has overstepped marginally here
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, and he clears his front leg and swipes it over the leaping mid-on fielder. Wasn't quite off the middle of the bat but he just clears the fielder
back of a length outside off, punched into the covers
back of a length outside off, extra bounce on this occasion and Tamim gets his bat out of the way, lifting it high over his head
short and wide to start and Soumya frees his arms to punch it away through the big gap between backward point and cover point
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
back of a length, angling into off stump, shuffles across to work it to the left of midwicket
full outside off, Soumya looks to drive through square cover and ends up playing a little early, off the inside half of the bat back to the bowler
length ball angling in towards middle and off, stays on the back foot and defends into the point region
back of a length outside off, lets it come on and eases it down to third man
too full, angling in towards off stump, whipped away to the right of mid-on
length ball, angling into the fifth-stump line, defended into the covers
length ball angling in towards off stump, blocked into the covers
back of a length angling in towards off stump, defended to mid-on
full, a bit of width, Soumya reaches for the ball and slices this drive over the point region
length ball close to off stump, lets it come on and defends towards backward point

shortish, angling in towards middle stump and tucking Tamim up for room. Defends with soft hands into the leg side and looks for the quick single but Cottrell is alert, he closes it down quickly in his follow-through
shortish on off stump, jumps back and across to ride the bounce and works it away through square leg
back of a length close to off stump, defends with soft hands, down to the man at gully
full on middle and leg, flicked to deep square leg, was briefly in the air
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
short outside off, Tamim gets up on his toes and cuts it hard, but straight to the man at backward point
looks to go full from round the wicket, ends up sliding a fair way down the leg side
length ball, plenty of width, slapped firmly to cover point

shot! Full, angling into a fourth-stump line, and Sarkar simply shows it the full face, uses the angle nicely, and drives sweetly between the non-striker and mid-on. Was in the air briefly but it didn't matter since it was in the gap
full outside off, bit more of a diagonal bat on this drive, hits it straight to mid-on
length ball off and Soumya has smashed that. Nice stride forward, and he gets underneath the ball and extends his arms through a super drive high over mid-off
short now, on off stump, and Soumya puts this away too, pulls it off the front foot in front of square
length ball on off stump, defended into the cover point region
ooh, some late swing away from the left-hander. Full and wide outside off, was there to drive, but the late swing takes it past Tamim's outside edge
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face and steers it past the gully fielder down to third man
shortish on off stump, rolls his wrists over on top of the bounce to play it down towards midwicket
fullish outside off, presses forward and defends with soft hands to gully
overpitched on off stump, and Soumya plays a wristy on-drive. Well fielded by Reifer, diving right at mid-on
bang. That's beautiful from Tamim. Half-volley outside off, and the front elbow is high and proud as he leans into this drive between cover point and extra-cover
tossed up full on off stump, driven into the covers
flat length ball on off stump, stays back and punches to short extra
speared full on off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
tossed up slower, angling in towards middle stump, gets on the front foot to clip to midwicket
tossed up again, drops onto a nice length and spins away from off stump, gets forward and across and defends back down the pitch
length ball close to off stump, defends with soft hands to backward point
drifts onto the pads, Soumya clips it away to the left of fine leg
length ball angling in towards middle stump, gets on the front foot to clip through square leg
length ball close to off stump. Looks to punch through cover point, plays a bit early and ends up hitting it back towards the bowler

fuller now, and Soumya goes hard at it, lifts it high - but not too far - over mid-off, and it drops down some 3/4ths of the way to the boundary and comes to a stop. Soumya was standing and admiring his shot, and they end up only taking a single
in the blockhole, angling into off stump, jams down hurriedly to flick through square leg
ooh, nearly. Goes hard at the cut and toe-ends it, sends it flying past the left hand of the diving slip fielder
down the track now as Nurse gives this some air, gets into the perfect position to drill this drive past the bowler's right foot
length ball outside off, stretches out to defend

bowled him! Nurse delivers the breakthrough. Tamim jumps down the track again, but this time he isn't quite to the pitch of the ball. It dips on him, and zips through with the angle. Tamim plays for turn, looking to block it hurriedly, and it sneaks through the gate and hits leg stump
flat length ball angling in towards middle stump, clipped to midwicket
nicely flighted outside off, defended towards backward point
short, gets it up to about shoulder height outside off. Pulled away nicely to deep square leg, rolls his wrists over to keep it down
back of a length on off stump, looks to get on top of the bounce and work it square on the leg side, ends up hitting it down into his pads
shortish, angling into Shakib's midriff, tucked awkwardly into the square leg region
length ball angling into off stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, pulled off the front foot to the left of deep square leg
slower length ball close to off stump, presses forward, waits, and defends into the point region
back of a length on off stump, waits on it and plays a soft-hands push into the point region
back of a length close to off stump, punched to deep cover
length ball sliding onto the pads, clipped to deep square leg
length ball on off stump, driven down to long-off
tossed up slower and wider, stretches out to drive through point
full on off stump, driven to short extra-cover
back of a length close to off stump. Makes a bit of room to cut and Carter dives to his left to stop it at backward point
slower length ball close to off stump, stretches out to defend
short, wide, stops on Shakib, slapped to the man at cover
dangled up wide of off stump, driven to sweeper cover
full on middle and off, driven inside-out into the cover point region
lots of flight again, wide of off, Shakib plays a flat-bat drive through cover point
full on off stump, driven to long-on
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, makes room to carve it away but backward point dives left to stop it
back of a length close to off stump, punched to deep point
nicely bowled. Flights it, angling into middle stump, and Shakib looks to make room to punch into the covers. Ends up skidding on with the angle and cramping him, forcing him to defend instead
length ball angling into the stumps, punched down to long-on
tossed up on off stump, driven to sweeper cover
flat length ball on off stump, opens his bat face and stabs to backward point
a bit of flight, a lot of width, and Soumya frees his arms and lofts this cleanly over wide long-off
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room to punch through point
flighted ball on middle and off, driven inside-out to the left of deep cover
length ball on middle and off, defended into the covers

ooh, nearly a catch! Length ball outside off and Soumya misreads the length, thinks it's fuller than it actually is. Pushes at it with hard hands, and the ball pops up in the air towards Fabian Allen at short extra-cover. He's a little late diving forward - might well have carried to him if he hadn't been on his heels for so long
full outside off, looks to drive to mid-off and Nurse moves quickly to intercept
length ball outside off, spins sharply to beat the outside edge as Soumya pushes forward to drive into the covers
fuller, angling into the stumps, clipped to midwicket
flat length ball on off stump, defended from the crease into the point region
stays back to a length ball outside off, punches into the point region
flat, back of a length, a bit of width, punched away through cover point
tossed up close to off stump, presses forward and defends with an open face into the point region
flatter and fuller, on middle stump, defended into the covers
nice change of pace, slows it down. Driven back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, punched to short extra
slower and straighter, clipped off the front foot through backward square leg
tossed up outside off, chipped in the air, but in the gap at cover point
goes back to a length ball on off stump, punches it to the off-side sweeper
dangled up full on off stump, slightly lazy footwork from Soumya as he tries to push into the covers. Ends up kind of yorking himself and jamming the ball into the turf
flighted ball, wider outside off, driven through the covers to bring up an excellent half-century. His timing has really stood out today
shot. Not that short, and it's on off stump, so he has to clear his front leg and crouch a little to manufacture the room needed to pull it away over midwicket
full, angling into the pads, clipped to midwicket
short, wide, cracked away to the right of the man sweeping at deep point
tosses it up from round the wicket, Shakib is forward to block
drifts into middle stump and Shakib, trying to drive down the ground, inside edges the ball onto his boot
pulls his length back on off stump, Shakib adjusts to that and pushes to cover
exploits the angle into his legs and turns the full ball to long leg
quicker ball on middle, Soumya is alert to the variation and blocks
slider, going on with the arm and Soumya, much like West Indies in their entire innings, plays for turn and gets an inside edge
stays back, making room to the good length ball on off stump and punching it to long-off
calmly tucks the full one on the pads round the corner to deep square leg
rocks back and pulls the shortish delivery from outside off stump to deep midwicket
dropped as steps out and hoicks it to midwicket. Roach is inside the circle, and it comes straight to him, and pops straight out
full on off stump, he drives back at the bowler
keeps to his crease and lets his wrists do all the work, nudging a fairly full ball off his pads behind square leg
very full - almost a yorker - on middle stump. Shakib drills it to long-off
full on middle, Soumya blocks towards point, looking for a single. Shakib says no
misfield at point, the man diving to his right to try and stop a deft little late cut from Soumya
sliding on with the arm on middle and leg, Shakib works it to midwicket
does well, spotting Shakib coming down the track, and then it's the batsman's turn to show some tricks, getting in position for the cut shot and almost getting it past short third man
now he hits that gap past short third man, helped, no doubt, by Chase going fast, short and outside off. All Shakib has to do is wait for the ball and give it direction.
steps out to the pitch of the ball on middle and leg and launches it down to long-on
another fine shot, this time going inside out so that the offbreak from round the wicket, meant to cramp him on middle and leg, is lifted back over the bowler's head. Superb strokeplay

taken at short cover! He's not to the pitch of the ball, having come down the track too early and giving Nurse the opportunity to change his length, and also go tight into his pads. It's a lot shorter now, it's a lot closer now, but Shakib is committed to the shot. Goes for the drive, tries to lift it over the infield, no such luck.
works it away through midwicket

there's a neeeeervous juggle, but he takes it in the end. Ambris at short midwicket this time as another Bangladesh player mis-hits a lofted shot. Soumya wants to get under the ball, nicely tossed up outside off, and clip it over the leg side field for a couple of runs, but the ball isn't quite as full as he thinks he is. It grips. it turns. It takes a leading edge and poof. He's gone
goes round the wicket and nearly has him lbw as Mithun shuffles right across his crease to take a length ball on off stump and drop it past square leg
shifts back and nudges the length ball on middle to midwicket
drives smoothly to long-on
presses forward to the pitch of a tossed up offbreak and turns it behind square leg
ends up right across all three stumps again as he dinks a ball on middle and off stump behind square leg. Big lbw candidate
gets forward and blocks outside off, opening the face
defends a full delivery on off stump
works the flatter delivery on middle to deep midwicket

has Mithun been run out?! Oooh, it's close, but he's just in. Very risky run from Mushfiqur, but he likes to keep things ticking, especially after quick wickets. And though that's a good idea, dinking the ball so close to a very good fielder like Jonathan Carter at first slip is asking for trouble. He runs to his right, to where short point would be, dives head-first at the ball, grabs it with his right hand and then flicks it, while he's still suspended in the air, under his body at the keeper. Epic fielding skillz
sweeps through midwicket and sprints through for the second
rocks back and cuts the ball to deep point
works the ball through square leg
tosses it up on off stump from round the wicket, defends
short and wide and Mushfiqur cracks it to the sweeper cover
outside edge as Allen has the batsman reaching outside the off stump with a little dip and a little turn.
good length, outside off, Mushfiqur leaves. Brave leave

Mithun should have been run out. He goes for a reverse sweep and just sets off. Not realising Nurse is onto the ball quickly, moving to his left. Mushfiqur is aware of it though and, after taking a couple of steps forward, yells no and at that point, Mithun loses his footing and falls on his backside. He's stranded in the middle of the pitch with no way back. All Nurse has to do is lob the ball to the keeper... and he messes it up, sending it way over the keeper
full and outside off, he drives to long-off
goes back and cuts behind point
shortish and outside off, he goes for a cut, but only under-edges it on the bounce to the keeper
steps down the pitch and lofts the length ball on middle straight over the bowler's head. He's doesn't get to the pitch of the ball but backed himself to pull it off
full on off stump, defends
flicks the length ball on middle stump through square leg
full on off stump, defends
gets forward to the pitch of the ball on off stump and blocks
drives to cover
blocks on middle
drives strongly to long-on
full and outside off, he cracks it to the right of cover
dabs the shortish delivery outside off to backward point
looks to punch a rising delivery outside off over the covers, but the extra bounce from the very tall Holder makes him skew the shot over point
works the length ball on middle behind square leg
beats him with an offcutter that stays low. Mushfiqur is set up for the glide to third man but it doesn't come out right
strays on the pads and Mushfiqur deflects it away to the long leg boundary. Cricket 101
gets the back of a length ball to straighten and Mushfiqur guides it off the open face to deep third man
strong shot - getting down low to a length ball outside off and sweeping it in front of square leg. A Mushfiqur special
walks across his stumps and gets cramped up as Allen pulls his length back and keeps it on off stump. Mushfiqur can only block
drives a tossed up delivery outside off to cover

now behind square, the sweep shot with great class. And the reason he goes behind square is because WI put a fielder in front. So now, when he gets across his stumps and gets on top of the ball, he rolls his wrists specifically so he can place it in the newly created gap.
good length outside off, defends
goes back to a good length ball that skids onto off stump. There's danger here for Mushfiqur but his hands help him adjust quickly enough
poor bowling again from West Indies. The captain now straying onto the pads with fine leg up. What do you think happened next? (Hint, leg glance for four)
huge appeal for lbw, and with Mithun always going across his stumps, he's always going to be candidate for that. But here the indipper might just have gone down leg
back of a length ball climbs up on Mushfiqur, but he blunts it well to point
full and outside off, he blocks in front of point
blocks the shortish delivery on off stump
full on off stump, drives back at the bowler
full from round the wicket, perhaps looking for a yorker. Mushfiqur defends well

nearly a return catch as the left-arm round angle helps him angle the ball into the right-hander, his own skill helps it straighten. Mushfiqur is committed to the flick and is startled as a top edge goes back towards Reifer. Falls short eventually
shortish and outside off, he punches to point
full on off stump, he drives to mid-off
slower ball this time, pitching on a good length on off stump, Mushfiqur defends well
goes for the on the up drive and places it to the left of the sweeper. Good stuff

oooh, that's lovely. More evidence that the slower balls are getting a lot of purchace on this pitch. This one straightens against the angle and might be kicking up at the right-hander too. Mithun is way too early into his block and is beaten on the outside edge, the ball flicking his pocket through to the keeper
taps to backward point, doing better to ride the bounce
full on middle and leg, tucks it to midwicket
full on off stump, defends
takes the pace off again and its because of that that the cut shot goes straight to point
full on off stump, defends
shortish and on off stump, defends with an open face

dropped... essentially because Roach misjudges a simple catch at deep square leg. He comes forward as Mithun pulls the ball, underestimating the power on the shot. had he stayed on the boundary, it would've been a dolly. Could've been a maiden ODI wicket for Reifer. And a game-breaking one at that
fuller delivery, and slower too, on off stump. Defends
slices a back of a length delivery outside off to third man
another slower ball, hitting a good length and getting it to straighten against the angle round the wicket. Mushfiqur does well to play late and block it behind point
gets up nice and tall to deal with a bouncer on middle, pulling it through midwicket
good length on off stump, defends
steps down the track and lifts it over midwicket. Oustanding shot. Impeccable connection. It's actually out of the ground
opens the face and guides it down to third man
uppish, as the attempted square drive skews off the outside edge and flies away behind point.
dinks a shortish delivery on leg stump behind square leg
clips a length ball on leg stump to long leg
slower ball on off stump, Mithun plays it well, spotting the variation and blocking it with all his might
wanders down leg as he goes for the flick
works it through midwicket
attempts a hook, but the ball is onto him too quickly, the bouncer, climbing up past his shoulder. And it's because of that that he mis-hits it to third man
pulls it round the corner to long leg

slower ball outside off, he defends behind point and thinks about a single. But Carter is across quickly enough. Misfilds though which makes Mithun think a single is on. But Mushfiqur sends him back just in time
glides a short ball outside off to third man
gets up off his toes and glides the short ball on off stump to deep third man
defends a good length ball on off stump
dabs the shortish delivery to point
full on off stump, dinks it to mid-on and runs
looks to glide the back of a length ball outside off to third man, but is beaten. Holder and Hope appeal for a caught behind, but even they don't seem convinced
full on off stump, defends to point
pulls the short ball from outside off down to deep midwicket
adjusts to the change in pace outside off and then chops down on top of it to get a single to third man
pulls it over long leg, uses the angle round the wicket to his advantage as he swivels on the back foot and lifts it over the hospitality section of the ground
opens the face and steers the shortish ball outside off to point
slower ball on off stump, defends
shortish and outside off, steers it to deep third man
short, angling in towards off stump, doesn't really time this pull, sends it rolling along to the right of deep square leg
short again, outside off this time, pulled round to deep square leg

bowled him, Holder breaks the partnership. Lovely delivery, full but not a half-volley, and it nips in off the pitch to burst through the massive gap between bat and pad as Mithun looks for the big drive into the covers
back of a length close to off stump, stays leg-side of the ball  and jabs towards backward point
fullish outside off, presses forward and opens his bat face to get off the mark with a single to third man
length ball outside off, good stride forward to block towards backward point
back of a length, a touch too straight, tucked off the legs to fine leg
back of a length on off stump, rides the bounce nicely and looks to guide it down to third man, but backward point moves quickly to his left and dives to stop it. Carter the fielder
full on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length, fifth-stump line, gets back and across to defend to backward point
short outside off, chops down on top of the bounce to place it to the right of third man
slower bouncer over leg stump, adjudged wide after Mahmudullah lets it pass. Height the issue, I'm guessing
shortish outside off, chopped down to third man
short, wide, lots of bounce, and Mahmudullah can't really keep the cut down, but he places it well, a fair distance to the right of third man
short, angling into the body, gets up to about waist height. Swivels and pulls it round to fine leg
back of a length angling in towards off stump, clipped to midwicket
length ball angling into middle stump, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length, angling in towards top of off, defended into the covers

dropped. Length ball, fifth-stump line. Presses forward to defend and he plays with a slightly open face. Ends up edging it to the right of the keeper, and Hope throws himself across for the low chance, stretches out one glove, and can't hold on in the end
back of a length, angling away from off stump, punched into the point region
in the blockhole on off and middle, jams his bat down in a hurry to keep it out
back of a length, leg-stumpish, tucked away to fine leg. Leg byes is the signal from the umpire, may have gone off just thigh pad
in the blockhole once more, on middle stump, clipped back to the bowler. Seemed to swing back into the right-hander late
full on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
full-toss on leg stump, just under waist high, played down to midwicket with the bottom hand off the handle
stays back to a length ball on off stump, defends towards backward point
down the track, and Mahmudullah has hoisted that onto the rooftops. Swings freely through a big drive that ends up clearing the wide long-on boundary by a long, long way
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and nudges it to the right of midwicket with soft hands
in the blockhole on off stump, jabbed into the off side
full on off stump, clipped neatly down to long-on
shortish on off stump, rides the bounce and bunts it down in front of midwicket
back of a length on off stump, leans back and chops it to backward point
half-volley on off stump, Nurse dives right at short cover to stop Mushfiqur's drive
back of a length on middle stump, stays leg-side of the ball and hops to ride the bounce, defends down towards backward point
short, gets up to chest height on leg stump, Mushfiqur pulls it round to long leg
shortish, tucked off the hip to the left of long leg
back of a length, middle and leg line, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and defends to backward point with an open face
down the track, makes himself a bit of room, and Roach follows him by darting one at his feet. Clipped to midwicket
shortish, angling in towards middle stump. Looks to pull and bottom-edges into his body
short outside off, pulled to the right of deep square leg
slower yorker on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
shortish on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
in the blockhole on off stump, jabbed towards mid-off. Rolls slowly to the fielder and that gives them the time to hurry through for one
back of a length, fourth-stump line, punched crisply to the right of deep point
slower ball, full on leg stump, clipped to long-on
length ball angling away from off stump, presses forward and punches towards backward point
full, close to off stump, shows the full face to punch to mid-off
loopy slower ball angling away into a sixth-stump line. Looks to open his bat face and steer it down to third man, sends it rolling to the keeper off the toe end
yorker on middle stump, jabbed back to the bowler
slower short ball, sits up on off stump, pulled to the left of deep square leg to bring up a brilliantly paced fifty

and he celebrates with a glorious piece of timing. Looks for the yorker again, on off stump, but it ends up as a low full-toss, and Mushfiqur just meets it with a straight bat and sends it racing away to the boundary to the right of deep point
short, gets up near the right shoulder. An awkward place to pull from, and he ends up ballooning it in the air, over midwicket and to his left
slower ball, full and wide, and Mushfiqur gets on the front foot and thumps it over cover
short, angling into off stump, pulled to deep square leg
fullish on off stump, driven to deep point
length ball close to off stump, hangs back and dabs to backward point with an open face

excellent short ball, angling across Mahmudullah's body without getting too far away from him, and bouncing awkwardly, causing him to jump. Appeal for caught behind as Mahmudullah tries to get his gloves away from the line - I think he's managed it just in time, and so does the umpire
on the legs now, tucked away to fine leg
length ball, lots of width, Mushfiqur slashes at it without moving his feet, and fails to make contact
back of a length on leg stump, worked to the right of deep square leg

oh no, that wasn't really necessary. Roach bowls this on a length, angling into the stumps, and Mushfiqur goes for the big lap-scoop. Middles it well enough, but he ends up picking out the man on the fine leg boundary
full, angling in towards off stump, defends towards midwicket
bouncer outside off, bounces well over head height and Mahmudullah has to abort his attempted hook
full on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
full, angling into the pads, clipped to the left of fine leg
fullish, angling in towards middle stump, clipped to midwicket
full on middle stump, this time he shows the full face and picks up a single to long-on to keep the strike
overpitched, plenty of width, and Chase throws himself to his left on the point boundary to make sure Bangladesh have to wait for the winning shot
full on off stump, drives to deep point with an open face to level the scores
bouncer down the leg side, and Sabbir ducks even though he's well away from the firing line. It's called wide, and that completes Bangladesh's win
